logging

Class LogWindowManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • logging.LogWindowManager

  • public abstract class LogWindowManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A really complicated class to manage a log window that automatically scrolls down to the latest output. My favorite feature is the monospace font.
    Author:
    twtduck

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean isInstantiated

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static javax.swing.JScrollPane getScrollpane()
      Gives the Log class the ability to set the scroll bar
      static java.awt.Dimension getSize()
      Get the size of the log window to place the scan window intelligently
      static void hide()
      Hide the log window
      static void init()
      What is an abstract class without an init method? Still an abstract class, dummy! In all seriousness, this needs to be run before trying to show the window.
      static void show()
      Show the log window
      static void write(java.lang.String text)
      Writes text to the log window.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init()
        What is an abstract class without an init method? Still an abstract class, dummy! In all seriousness, this needs to be run before trying to show the window. Otherwise, null pointer exceptions incoming!

      • show

        public static void show()
        Show the log window

      • hide

        public static void hide()
        Hide the log window

      • write

        public static void write(java.lang.String text)
        Writes text to the log window. This is to be used only from the Log class' write() method.
        Parameters:
        text - text to write

      • getSize

        public static java.awt.Dimension getSize()
        Get the size of the log window to place the scan window intelligently
        Returns:
        the size of the log window as a Dimension object

      • getScrollpane

        public static javax.swing.JScrollPane getScrollpane()
        Gives the Log class the ability to set the scroll bar
        Returns:
        the scroll pane
